Activity: Log in, check emails. Follow up on the email to @rn-1, @rn-2, and @rn-3 regarding EHR documentation feedback. Review the data quality improvement plan and make any necessary revisions.
Continue cross-validating data elements, focusing on lab results and prescriptions. Pay close attention to the units of measurement and the interpretation of lab values.

Analyze the discrepancies identified during cross-validation to determine the root causes. Identify any patterns or trends that may indicate systemic issues. Consider the impact of the discrepancies on data analysis and reporting.

Based on the root cause analysis, refine the data quality improvement plan. Add specific recommendations for addressing the identified issues. Consider involving the appropriate stakeholders in the implementation of the plan (e.g., clinicians, IT staff, data analysts).

Contact @trainer-1 via email: "Request for Data Entry Training". Request a data entry training session for clinical staff, focusing on the accurate and complete documentation of influenza cases in the EHR system. Emphasize the importance of using standardized terminologies and following established procedures.

Review the data quality improvement plan with @ehrdev-1 and @ehrdev-2 to explore potential system modifications that could improve data quality. Consider implementing data validation rules, automated alerts, and user-friendly data entry forms.
Start working on the final report that summarizes the data quality assessment findings, the proposed data quality improvement plan, and the recommendations for future data collection efforts.
